Articles.Content:
*If this is against the rules i'm sorry, i'm new to the forums:blush:*

I wont to make a YouTube challenge season and i was wondering if any of you would watch me. If you will, Please leave me a some challenges to do in this season. If i get a enough support behind this season ill make shore to do it for a long time. This season is intended to be in sandbox but if you wont me to do it in one of the other 2 ill be up for negotiation.

I am not planing to use any game changing mods in this season just things like Kerbal Alarm Clock and Kerbal Engineer but if you wont to suggest a mods for me to add do so.

I hope ill see you all on YouTube.

Ã¢â‚¬â€¹Suggestions So Far.

  • none

Just one question: how far have you gone in KSP so far? I know this isn't the best way to measure how good you are at the game, but what is the most distant object on the kerbol system you've landed on?

When you answer that, I'll add a few more suggestions. But for now...:

1) fly from KSC to the island runway in IVA, but have the cockpit in reverse (flying backwards, in a way). It takes some practice, but is possible.
the furthest i have ever got in ksp is a low pass of the sun, but is mostly because i play science mode and just haven't got that far in my games.

the furthest i have ever got in ksp is a low pass of the sun, but is mostly because i play science mode and just haven't got that far in my games.

Ah, interesting. Perhaps you could do something like scott manley's "interstellar quest", but do it with the stock tech tree and not the interstellar one. Could throw in some planet's from krags planet factory, if you want.

Or, you could use a gravity assist from a planet to another - choices:

- to Jool

- to Sentar (planet factory, could mod inclination a bit?)

Edited October 5, 2014 by TJPrime
I would use planet factory but i can never get it to work.

I would use planet factory but i can never get it to work.

What do you mean? Does it crash when loading or do you not see the planets? If it crashes, install a texture management mod, like active texture management. If you don't see the planets, you might have put it in wrong
i dont see the planets but iv followed the install instructions exactly

i dont see the planets but iv followed the install instructions exactly

Chances are something went wrong with the download. Here is a download link for it. Download it as a ZIP file, then put the 'planet factory' folder directly into the gamedata folder in KSP. Just to be sure, y'know?

But here is another challenge: try to make an SSTO for kerbin, but the capsule is facing backwards. Also, you would need to be in IVA mode.
